title: Pep Guardiola urges Man City to prove they have mentality to win Champions League
text:

Pep Guardiola has challenged his Manchester City players to show they have the mentality to win the Champions League.

Guardiola has made the astonishing claim that City are still not ready to conquer Europe, despite splashing out over £1billion during their nine successive seasons in the competition.

The City boss claims they have made fatal mistakes at key moments in their three defeats under him in the knock-out stages and says they need a stronger mindset.

“In this competition, you play against incredible players and if you give some team in one moment, a metre, they will score,” said Guardiola ahead of tonight’s group clash at home to Atalanta. “We have to know that.

(Image: PA)

“These little margins are sometimes the difference and we’re working on that.

“I believe this kind of situation is about the mentality. We’re good enough and we’re strong enough and when you play good, you defend less.

“When you don’t play good, you concede a lot. It’s not about having those two defenders and they’re going to defend for 11 players. When your build-up is good, you concede few goals and we conceded few for four seasons.”

Two of City’s Champions League exits under Guardiola were on away goals to Monaco in 2017 and Tottenham last season and Guardiola says they need to be better defensively as a unit.

(Image: Reuters)

(Image: Manchester Evening News)

“Two times in the Champions League we went out on goal difference and in both games we conceded a lot of goals,” said the Catalan.

“For example, we scored four here against Tottenham, five goals against Monaco, but we conceded a lot.

“It’s not just about discipline because when we conceded three goals against Tottenham here, it was with Vinnie Kompany and Aymeric Laporte and during the last part of last season they were incredible, they were outstanding.

“It’s not a case of just defending well, if you play well in all departments, you concede really few. We need to have that mentality.”
description: Guardiola had suggested City are not yet ready to conquer Europe but has issued a challenge ahead of the clash with Atalanta
